6) the 11th letter of the Roman alphabet

k2.definition: a mountain peak in the Karakoram Range in northern Kashmir; the 2nd highest peak in the world (28,250 feet high)

ka.definition: unknown god; an epithet of Prajapati and Brahma

kaaba.definition: (Islam) a black stone building in Mecca that is shaped like a cube and that is the most sacred Muslim pilgrim shrine; believed to have been given by Gabriel to Abraham; Muslims turn in its direction when praying

kabbalah.definition: an esoteric theosophy of rabbinical origin based on the Hebrew scriptures and developed between the 7th and 18th centuries

kabob.definition: cubes of meat marinated and cooked on a skewer usually with vegetables

kabul.definition: the capital and largest city of Afghanistan; located in eastern Afghanistan

kachin.definition: Tibeto-Burman languages spoken in northernmost Burma and adjacent China and India

kachina.definition:
1) a masked dancer during a Pueblo religious ceremony who is thought to embody some particular spirit
2) a deified spirit of the Pueblo people
3) a carved doll wearing the costume of a particular Pueblo spirit; usually presented to a child as a gift

kadai.definition: a family of Sino-Tibetan languages spoken in southeastern Asia

kaffiyeh.definition: an Arab headdress consisting of a square piece of cloth folded into a triangle and fastened over the crown by an agal

kaffir.definition: an offensive and insulting term for any Black African

kafir.definition: a member of the Kafir people in northeastern Afghanistan

kafiri.definition: a Dardic language spoken by the Kafir in northeastern Afghanistan

kafka.definition: Czech novelist who wrote in German about a nightmarish world of isolated and troubled individuals (1883-1924)

kafkaesque.definition:
1) relating to or in the manner of Franz Kafka or his writings
2) characterized by surreal distortion and a sense of impending danger

examples.en: the kafkaesque terror of the endless interrogations

kahikatea.definition: New Zealand evergreen valued for its light easily worked wood

examples: we kayaked down the river

kainite.definition: a white mineral consisting of magnesium sulphate and potassium chloride; a source of potassium salts; used as a fertilizer

kaiser.definition: the title of the Holy Roman Emperors or the emperors of Austria or of Germany until 1918

kakemono.definition: a Japanese (paper or silk) wall hanging; usually narrow with a picture or writing on it and a roller at the bottom

kaki.definition: blackish stilt of New Zealand sometimes considered a color phase of the white-headed stilt

kalahari.definition: a desert in southwestern Africa - largely Botswana

kalapooian.definition: a Penutian language spoken by the Kalapuya

kalashnikov.definition: a type of submachine gun made in Russia

kale.definition:
2) a hardy cabbage with coarse curly leaves that do not form a head
3) coarse curly-leafed cabbage

kaleidoscope.definition:
1) a complex pattern of constantly changing colors and shapes
2) an optical toy in a tube; it produces symmetrical patterns as bits of colored glass are reflected by mirrors

kali.definition: wife of Siva and malevolent form of Devi

kalinin.definition: soviet statesman and head of state of the USSR (1875-1946)

kalki.definition: the 10th and last incarnation of Vishnu

kalmia.definition: any plant of the genus Kalmia

kaluga.definition: a city of central Russia to the south of Moscow

kalumpang.definition: large tree of Old World tropics having foul-smelling orange-red blossoms followed by red pods enclosing oil-rich seeds sometimes used as food

kama.definition: Hindu god of love and erotic desire; opposite of Mara

kamasutra.definition: (Hinduism) an ancient Sanskrit text giving rules for sensuous and sensual pleasure and love and marriage in accordance with Hindu law

kamba.definition: a Bantu language spoken by the Kamba in Kenya

kamet.definition: a mountain in the Himalayas in northern India (25,450 feet high)

kami.definition: one the Shinto deities (including mythological beings, spirits of distinguished men, forces of nature)

kamikaze.definition:
1) a fighter plane used for suicide missions by Japanese pilots in World War II
2) a pilot trained and willing to cause a suicidal crash

kampala.definition: the capital and largest city of Uganda on the north shore of Lake Victoria

kanamycin.definition: antibiotic (trade name Kantrex) used to treat severe infections

kananga.definition: a city in southwestern Congo; former name (until 1966) was Luluabourg

kanara.definition: a historical region of southwestern India on the west coast

kanarese.definition: a member of a Kannada-speaking group of people living chiefly in Kanara in southern India

kanawha.definition: a tributary of the Ohio River in West Virginia

kanchenjunga.definition: a mountain the Himalayas on the border between Nepal and Tibet (28,208 feet high)

kandahar.definition: a city in southern Afghanistan; an important trading center

kandy.definition: a city of central Sri Lanka that was the last capital of the ancient kings of Ceylon; a resort and religious center

kandinsky.definition: Russian painter who was a pioneer of abstract art (1866-1944)

kangaroo.definition: any of several herbivorous leaping marsupials of Australia and New Guinea having large powerful hind legs and a long thick tail

kannada.definition: a Dravidian language spoken in southern India

kansa.definition:
1) a member of the Siouan people of the Kansas river valley in Kansas
2) the Dhegiha dialect spoken by the Kansa

kansan.definition: a native or resident of Kansas

kansas.definition:
1) a state in midwestern United States
3) a river in northeastern Kansas; flows eastward to become a tributary of the Missouri River

kantian.definition: of or relating to Immanuel Kant or his philosophy

kanzu.definition: (Swahili) a long garment (usually white) with long sleeves; worn by men in East Africa

kaoliang.definition: sorghums of China and Manchuria having small white or brown grains (used for food) and dry pithy stalks (used for fodder, fuel and thatching)

kaolinite.definition: a mineral consisting of aluminum silicate; main source of kaolin

kaon.definition: an unstable meson produced as the result of a high-energy particle collision

kaph.definition: the 11th letter of the Hebrew alphabet

kapok.definition:
1) a plant fiber from the kapok tree; used for stuffing and insulation
2) massive tropical tree with deep ridges on its massive trunk and bearing large pods of seeds covered with silky floss; source of the silky kapok fiber

kappa.definition: the 10th letter of the Greek alphabet

kapuka.definition: small New Zealand broadleaf evergreen tree often cultivated in warm regions as an ornamental

karachi.definition: the largest city in Pakistan; located in southeastern Pakistan; an industrial center and seaport on the Arabian Sea; former capital of Pakistan

karakoram.definition: a mountain range in northern Kashmir; an extension of the Hindu Kush; contains the 2nd highest peak

karaoke.definition: singing popular songs accompanied by a recording of an orchestra (usually in bars or nightclubs)

karat.definition: the unit of measurement for the proportion of gold in an alloy; 18-karat gold is 75% gold; 24-karat gold is pure gold

karate.definition: a traditional Japanese system of unarmed combat; sharp blows and kicks are given to pressure-sensitive points on the body of the opponent

karelia.definition: a region in Finland and Russia between the Gulf of Finland and the White Sea

karelian.definition:
1) a member of the Finnish people living in Karelia in northwestern European Russia
2) a Finnic language spoken by the people of Karelia

karen.definition: the Tibeto-Burman language spoken in the Thailand and Burmese borderlands

karyokinesis.definition: organic process consisting of the division of the nucleus of a cell during mitosis or meiosis

karyokinetic.definition: of or relating to the division of the nucleus of a cell during mitosis or meiosis

karyolymph.definition: a clear liquid in the cell nucleus in which the nucleolus and chromatin and other structures are dispersed

karyolysis.definition: disintegration and dissolution of a cell nucleus when a cell dies

karyotype.definition: the appearance of the chromosomal makeup of a somatic cell in an individual or species (including the number and arrangement and size and structure of the chromosomes)

karlfeldt.definition: Swedish poet whose works incorporate Swedish customs and folklore (1864-1931)

karloff.definition: United States film actor (born in England) noted for his performances in horror films (1887-1969)

karma.definition: (Hinduism and Buddhism) the effects of a person's actions that determine his destiny in his next incarnation

karnataka.definition: state in southern India; formerly Mysore

karpov.definition: Russian chess master who was world champion from 1975 until 1985 when he was defeated by Gary Kasparov (born in 1951)

kasai.definition: a river of southwestern Africa that rises in central Angola and flows east and then north (forming part of the border between Angola and Congo) and continuing northwest through Congo to empty into the Congo River on the border between Congo and Republic of the Congo

kasbah.definition: an older or native quarter of many cities in northern Africa; the quarter in which the citadel is located

kashmir.definition: an area in southwestern Asia whose sovereignty is disputed between Pakistan and India

kashmiri.definition:
1) of or relating to or characteristic of Kashmir or its people or culture
2) the official state language of Kashmir

kassite.definition:
1) a member of an ancient people who ruled Babylonia between 1600 and 1200 BC
2) an ancient language spoken by the Kassites

kat.definition: the leaves of the shrub Catha edulis which are chewed like tobacco or used to make tea; has the effect of a euphoric stimulant

examples.en: in Yemen kat is used daily by 85% of adults

katabatic.definition: of an air current or wind; moving downward or down a slope because of cooling especially at night

katamorphism.definition: metamorphism that occurs at or near the earth's surface; breaks down complex minerals into simpler ones

katharevusa.definition: literary style of Modern Greek containing features borrowed from Koine

kathmandu.definition: the capital and largest city of Nepal

katydid.definition: large green long-horned grasshopper of North America; males produce shrill sounds by rubbing together special organs on the forewings

katowice.definition: an industrial city of southern Poland

katsina.definition: a city in northern Nigeria; a major center of the Hausa people

katsuwonidae.definition: in some classifications considered a separate family comprising the oceanic bonitos

kauai.definition: an island of Hawaii to the northwest of Oahu

kaufman.definition: United States playwright who collaborated with many other writers including Moss Hart (1889-1961)

kaunda.definition: statesman who led Northern Rhodesia to full independence as Zambia in 1964 and served as Zambia's first president (1924-1999)

kauri.definition:
1) resin of the kauri trees of New Zealand; found usually as a fossil; also collected for making varnishes and linoleum
2) tall timber tree of New Zealand having white straight-grained wood
3) white close-grained wood of a tree of the genus Agathis especially Agathis australis

kava.definition: an alcoholic drink made from the aromatic roots of the kava shrub

kawaka.definition: New Zealand timber tree resembling the cypress

kazak.definition:
1) a Muslim who is a member of a Turkic people of western Asia (especially in Kazakstan)
3) the Turkic language spoken by the Kazak

kazakhstan.definition: a landlocked republic to the south of Russia and to the northeast of the Caspian Sea; the original Turkic-speaking inhabitants were overrun by Mongols in the 13th century; an Asian soviet from 1936 to 1991

kazan.definition:
1) United States stage and screen director (born in Turkey) and believer in method acting (1909-2003)
2) an industrial city in the European part of Russia

kazoo.definition: a toy wind instrument that has a membrane that makes a sound when you hum into the mouthpiece

kean.definition: English actor noted for his portrayals of Shakespeare's great tragic characters (1789-1833)

keaton.definition: United States comedian and actor in silent films noted for his acrobatic skills and deadpan face (1895-1966)

keble.definition: English clergyman who (with John Henry Newman and Edward Pusey) founded the Oxford movement (1792-1866)

kedgeree.definition: a dish of rice and hard-boiled eggs and cooked flaked fish

keel.definition:
1) a projection or ridge that suggests a keel
2) the median ridge on the breastbone of birds that fly
3) one of the main longitudinal beams (or plates) of the hull of a vessel; can extend vertically into the water to provide lateral stability

keelson.definition: a longitudinal beam connected to the keel of ship to strengthen it

keen.definition:
1) a funeral lament sung with loud wailing
5) having a sharp cutting edge or point

keenly.definition: in a keen and discriminating manner

examples.en: he was keenly aware of his own shortcomings

keep.definition:
1) keep in a certain state, position, or activity; e.g., "keep clean"
2) the main tower within the walls of a medieval castle or fortress
3) retain possession of

He is keeping three women in the guest cottage
He keeps the shop when I am gone

I keep a car in the countryside

She keeps an apartment in Paris for her shopping trips
She kept her maiden name after she married
The student was kept after school
The students keep me on my toes
These potatoes keep for a long time
Where do you keep your gardening tools?
keep food for a week in the pantry

keg.definition:
1) the quantity contained in a keg
2) small cask or barrel

key.definition:
1) metal device shaped in such a way that when it is inserted into the appropriate lock the lock's mechanism can be rotated
2) provide with a key
3) vandalize a car by scratching the sides with a key

examples.en: We were keyed after the locks were changed in the building
His new Mercedes was keyed last night in the parking lot

1) device consisting of a set of keys on a piano or organ or typewriter or typesetting machine or computer or the like
2) holder consisting of an arrangement of hooks on which keys or locks can be hung

keyed.definition:
1) fitted with or secured by a key
2) set to a key or tone

examples.en: the locks have not yet been keyed

keyhole.definition: the hole where a key is inserted

keyless.definition: lacking or not requiring a key

examples.en: a keyless lock operated by a series of pushbuttons

keynes.definition: English economist who advocated the use of government monetary and fiscal policy to maintain full employment without inflation (1883-1946)

keynesian.definition: of or relating to John Maynard Keynes or to his economic theories

keynesianism.definition: the economic theories of John Maynard Keynes who advocated government monetary and fiscal programs intended to stimulate business activity and increase employment

keynote.definition:

2) give the keynote address to (an audience)

examples.en: Comfort keynotes this designer's Fall collection

keystroke.definition: the stroke of a key; one depression of a key on a keyboard

examples.en: the number of keystrokes was used as a measure of work

kekchi.definition:
1) a member of a Mayan people of north central Guatemala
2) a Mayan language spoken by the Kekchi

keller.definition: United States lecturer and writer who was blind and deaf from the age of 19 months; Anne Sullivan taught her to read and write and speak; Helen Keller graduated from college and went on to champion the cause of blind and deaf people (1880-1968)

kelly.definition:
1) United States circus clown (1898-1979)
2) United States film actress who retired when she married into the royal family of Monaco (1928-1982)
3) United States dancer who performed in many musical films (1912-1996)

kellogg.definition: United States food manufacturer who (with his brother) developed a breakfast cereal of crisp flakes of rolled and toasted wheat and corn; he established a company to manufacture the cereal (1860-1951)

keloid.definition: raised pinkish scar tissue at the site of an injury; results from excessive tissue repair

kelp.definition: large brown seaweeds having fluted leathery fronds

kelpy.definition: (Scottish folklore) water spirit in the form of a horse that likes to drown its riders

kelpie.definition: an Australian sheepdog with pointed ears

kelvin.definition:
1) the basic unit of thermodynamic temperature adopted under the Systeme International d'Unites
2) British physicist who invented the Kelvin scale of temperature and pioneered undersea telegraphy (1824-1907)

kenaf.definition:
1) fiber from an East Indian plant Hibiscus cannabinus
2) valuable fiber plant of East Indies now widespread in cultivation

kendall.definition: United States biochemist who discovered cortisone (1886-1972)

kendrew.definition: English biologist noted for studies of the molecular structure of blood components (born in 1917)

kenya.definition: a republic in eastern Africa; achieved independence from the United Kingdom in 1963; major archeological discoveries have been made in the Great Rift Valley in Kenya

kenyan.definition: of or relating to or characteristic of Kenya or its people

kennan.definition: United States diplomat who recommended a policy of containment in dealing with Soviet aggression (1904-2005)

kennedy.definition:
1) 35th President of the United States; established the Peace Corps; assassinated in Dallas (1917-1963)
2) a large airport on Long Island to the east of New York City

kennelly.definition: United States electrical engineer noted for his work on the theory of alternating currents; independently of Oliver Heaviside he discovered the existence of an atmospheric layer that reflects radio waves back to earth (1861-1939)

kennewick.definition: a town in southern Washington on the Columbia River

kenning.definition: conventional metaphoric name for something, used especially in Old English and Old Norse poetry

kent.definition:
1) a county in southeastern England on the English Channel; formerly an Anglo-Saxon kingdom, it was the first to be colonized by the Romans
2) United States painter noted for his woodcuts (1882-1971)

kentish.definition:
1) one of the major dialects of Old English
2) a dialect of Middle English

kentucky.definition: a state in east central United States; a border state during the American Civil War; famous for breeding race horses

kentuckian.definition: a native or resident of Kentucky

keokuk.definition: Sauk leader who aided the United States against Black Hawk (1790-1848)

kepi.definition: a cap with a flat circular top and a visor

kepler.definition: German astronomer who first stated laws of planetary motion (1571-1630)

keratectasia.definition: abnormal bulging of the cornea of the eye

keratin.definition: a fibrous scleroprotein that occurs in the outer layer of the skin and in horny tissues such as hair, feathers, nails, and hooves

keratinization.definition: organic process by which keratin is deposited in cells and the cells become horny (as in nails and hair)

keratinize.definition:
1) convert into keratin
2) become horny and impregnated with keratin

keratitis.definition: inflammation of the cornea causing watery painful eyes and blurred vision

keratoconjunctivitis.definition: inflammation of the cornea and conjunctiva

keratoconus.definition: abnormal cone-shaped protrusion of the cornea of the eye; can be treated by epikeratophakia

keratoderma.definition: any skin disorder consisting of a growth that appears horny

keratoiritis.definition: inflammation of the cornea and the iris of the eye

keratomalacia.definition: softening and drying and ulceration of the cornea resulting from vitamin A deficiency; symptom of cystic fibrosis or sprue

keratoplasty.definition: a surgical procedure in which part or all of a damaged or diseased cornea is replaced by healthy corneal tissue from a donor

keratoscope.definition: medical instrument to examine the cornea in order to detect irregularities in its anterior surface

keratoscopy.definition: examination of the cornea with a keratoscope to detect irregularities in its anterior surface

keratosis.definition: a skin condition marked by an overgrowth of layers of horny skin

kerchief.definition: a square scarf that is folded into a triangle and worn over the head or about the neck

kerensky.definition: Russian revolutionary who was head of state after Nicholas II abdicated but was overthrown by the Bolsheviks (1881-1970)

kerygma.definition: preaching the gospel of Christ in the manner of the early church

kern.definition:
1) furnish with a kern
2) remove a portion of space between (adjacent letters)

kernel.definition:
1) the inner and usually edible part of a seed or grain or nut or fruit stone
2) a single whole grain of a cereal
3) the choicest or most essential or most vital part of some idea or experience

examples.en: black walnut kernels are difficult to get out of the shell
the gist of the prosecutor's argument
the heart and soul of the Republican Party

kernite.definition: a light soft mineral consisting of hydrated sodium borate in crystalline form; an important source of boron

kerosene.definition: a flammable hydrocarbon oil used as fuel in lamps and heaters

kerouac.definition: United States writer who was a leading figure of the beat generation (1922-1969)

kestrel.definition: small Old World falcon that hovers in the air against a wind

ketch.definition: a sailing vessel with two masts; the mizzen is forward of the rudderpost

ketembilla.definition:
1) a small shrubby spiny tree cultivated for its maroon-purple fruit with sweet purple pulp tasting like gooseberries; Sri Lanka and India
2) maroon-purple gooseberry-like fruit of India having tart-sweet purple pulp used especially for preserves

ketohexose.definition: a monosaccharide having six carbon atoms and a ketone group

ketone.definition: any of a class of organic compounds having a carbonyl group linked to a carbon atom in each of two hydrocarbon radicals

ketonemia.definition: an abnormal increase of ketone bodies in the blood as in diabetes mellitus

ketonuria.definition: excessive amounts of ketone bodies in the urine as in diabetes mellitus or starvation

ketose.definition: any monosaccharide sugar that contains a ketone group or its hemiacetal

ketosteroid.definition: a steroid containing a ketone group

kettering.definition: United States electrical engineer who made numerous automotive improvements (including the electric starter) (1876-1958)

kettle.definition:
1) a metal pot for stewing or boiling; usually has a lid
2) the quantity a kettle will hold
4) a large hemispherical brass or copper percussion instrument with a drumhead that can be tuned by adjusting the tension on it

keurboom.definition:
1) fast-growing roundheaded tree with fragrant white to deep rose flowers; planted as an ornamental
2) tree with odd-pinnate leaves and racemes of fragrant pink to purple flowers

khabarovsk.definition:
1) a city on the Amur River on the border of China and the capital of Khabarovsk
2) an administrative territory in Russia on the eastern coast of Siberia

khachaturian.definition: Russian composer (born in Armenia) whose works are romantic and reflect his interest in folk music (1903-1978)

khadi.definition: a coarse homespun cotton cloth made in India

khakis.definition: a military uniform made of khaki fabric

khalkha.definition:
1) the Mongol people living in the central and eastern parts of Outer Mongolia
2) the language of the Khalkha that is the official language of the Mongolian People's Republic

khalsa.definition: the group of initiated Sikhs to which devout orthodox Sikhs are ritually admitted at puberty; founded by the tenth and last Guru in 1699

khama.definition: Botswanan statesman who was the first president of Botswana (1921-1980)

khamsin.definition: an oppressively hot southerly wind from the Sahara that blows across Egypt in the spring

khamti.definition: a branch of the Tai languages

khan.definition: a title given to rulers or other important people in Asian countries

khanate.definition:

khedive.definition: one of the Turkish viceroys who ruled Egypt between 1867 and 1914

khmer.definition:
1) the Mon-Khmer language spoken in Cambodia
2) a native or inhabitant of Cambodia

khoisan.definition: a family of languages spoken in southern Africa

khowar.definition: a Dardic language spoken in northwestern Pakistan

khrushchev.definition: Soviet statesman and premier who denounced Stalin (1894-1971)

ki.definition: goddess personifying earth; counterpart of Akkadian Aruru

kiang.definition: wild ass of Tibet and Mongolia

kyanite.definition: a grey or greenish-blue mineral consisting of aluminum silicate in crystalline form; occurs in metaphoric rock, used as a refractory

kyat.definition: the basic unit of money in Myanmar

kibble.definition:

2) an iron bucket used for hoisting in wells or mining

kibitzer.definition: (Yiddish) a meddler who offers unwanted advice to others

kick.definition:
1) drive or propel with the foot
2) thrash about or strike out with the feet
3) strike with the foot

kickapoo.definition:
1) a member of the Algonquian people formerly inhabiting southern Wisconsin and northern Illinois
2) the Algonquian language of the Kickapoo

kickback.definition: a commercial bribe paid by a seller to a purchasing agent in order to induce the agent to enter into the transaction

kicker.definition: a player who kicks the football

kickoff.definition:
1) (football) a kick from the center of the field to start a football game or to resume it after a score
3) a start given to contestants

kicksorter.definition: scientific instrument consisting of an electronic circuit that permits only voltage pulses of predetermined height to pass

2) be silly or tease one another
5) young goat

examples.en: After we relaxed, we just kidded around

kidnap.definition: take away to an undisclosed location against their will and usually in order to extract a ransom

kidnapper.definition: someone who unlawfully seizes and detains a victim (usually for ransom)

kidney.definition: either of two bean-shaped excretory organs that filter wastes (especially urea) from the blood and excrete them and water in urine

kieserite.definition: a white mineral consisting of hydrous magnesium sulfate often found in salt mines

kike.definition: (ethnic slur) offensive term for a Jew

kylie.definition: an Australian boomerang; one side flat and the other convex

kylix.definition: a shallow drinking cup with two handles; used in ancient Greece

4) be fatal

1) someone who causes the death of a person or animal

1) very funny

kilobit.definition: a unit of information equal to 1000 bits

kilobyte.definition:
1) a unit of information equal to 1000 bytes
2) a unit of information equal to 1024 bytes

kilogram.definition: one thousand grams; the basic unit of mass adopted under the Systeme International d'Unites

kilogram-meter.definition: a unit of work equal to the work done by a one kilogram force operating through a distance of one meter

kiloliter.definition: a metric unit of volume or capacity equal to 1000 liters

kilometer.definition: a metric unit of length equal to 1000 meters (or 0.621371 miles)

kiloton.definition:
1) one thousand tons
2) a measure of explosive power (of an atomic weapon) equal to that of 1000 tons of TNT

kilovolt.definition: a unit of potential equal to a thousand volts

kilovolt-ampere.definition: a unit of electrical power equal to 1000 volt-amperes

kilowatt.definition: a unit of power equal to 1000 watts

kilroy.definition: a nonexistent person popularized by American servicemen during World War II

kilt.definition: a knee-length pleated tartan skirt worn by men as part of the traditional dress in the Highlands of northern Scotland

kimberley.definition: city in central South Africa; center for diamond mining and diamond marketing

kimberlite.definition: a rare type of peridotite that sometimes contains diamonds; found in South Africa and Siberia

kymograph.definition: scientific instrument consisting of a rotating drum holding paper on which a stylus traces a continuous record (as of breathing or blood pressure)

kimono.definition: a loose robe; imitated from robes originally worn by Japanese

kin.definition:
1) a person having kinship with another or others
2) group of people related by blood or marriage

kina.definition: the basic unit of money in Papua New Guinea

kinase.definition: an enzyme that catalyzes the conversion of a proenzyme to an active enzyme

kind.definition:
1) having or showing a tender and considerate and helpful nature; used especially of persons and their behavior
2) agreeable, conducive to comfort
3) tolerant and forgiving under provocation

examples.en: a dry climate kind to asthmatics
our neighbor was very kind about the window our son broke

kindergarten.definition: a preschool for children age 4 to 6 to prepare them for primary school

kindhearted.definition: having or proceeding from an innately kind disposition

kindheartedness.definition: sympathy arising from a kind heart

kindle.definition:
1) catch fire
2) cause to start burning

examples.en: The dried grass of the prairie kindled, spreading the flames for miles
The setting sun kindled the sky with oranges and reds

kindly.definition:
1) in a kind manner or out of kindness
2) pleasant and agreeable

examples.en: He spoke kindly to the boy

kindliness.definition: friendliness evidence by a kindly and helpful disposition

kindness.definition:
1) the quality of being warmhearted and considerate and humane and sympathetic
3) a kind act

kinematics.definition: the branch of mechanics concerned with motion without reference to force or mass

kinescope.definition: a cathode-ray tube in a television receiver; translates the received signal into a picture on a luminescent screen

kinesiology.definition: the branch of physiology that studies the mechanics and anatomy in relation to human movement

kinesis.definition: a movement that is a response to a stimulus but is not oriented with respect to the source of stimulation

kinesthesia.definition: the perception of body position and movement and muscular tensions etc

kinesthesis.definition: the ability to feel movements of the limbs and body

kinesthetically.definition: in a kinesthetic manner; by means of kinesthesia

kinetic.definition:
1) relating to the motion of material bodies and the forces associated therewith
2) characterized by motion

examples.en: modern dance has been called kinetic pantomime

kinetoscope.definition: a device invented by Edison that gave an impression of movement as an endless loop of film moved continuously over a light source with a rapid shutter; precursor of the modern motion picture

king.definition:
1) a male sovereign; ruler of a kingdom
2) a competitor who holds a preeminent position
4) preeminence in a particular category or group or field

examples.en: the lion is the king of beasts

kingbolt.definition: bolt that provides a steering joint in a motor vehicle

kingdom.definition:
1) a domain in which something is dominant
2) a country with a king as head of state
3) the domain ruled by a king or queen

kingfish.definition:
1) the lean flesh of any of several fish caught off the Atlantic coast of the United States
4) any of several food and game fishes of the drum family indigenous to warm Atlantic waters of the North American coast
5) large game fish of Australia and New Zealand

kingfisher.definition: nonpasserine large-headed bird with a short tail and long sharp bill; usually crested and bright-colored; feed mostly on fish

kinglet.definition: small birds resembling warblers but having some of the habits of titmice

kingly.definition: having the rank of or resembling or befitting a king

examples.en: the murder of his kingly guest

kingmaker.definition: an important person who can bring leaders to power through the exercise of political influence

examples.en: the Earl of Warwick was the first kingmaker

kingpin.definition: the most important person in a group or undertaking

kingship.definition: the dignity or rank or position of a king

kingston.definition:
1) a town on the Hudson River in New York
2) a town in southeast Ontario on Lake Ontario near the head of the Saint Lawrence River
3) capital and largest city of Jamaica

kingstown.definition: the capital of Saint Vincent and the Grenadines; on Saint Vincent

kingwood.definition:
1) handsome violet-streaked wood of the kingwood tree; used especially in cabinetwork
2) Brazilian tree yielding a handsome cabinet wood

kinin.definition: any of a class of plant hormones that promote cell division and delay the senescence of leaves

kink.definition:
2) a sharp bend in a line produced when a line having a loop is pulled tight
3) a person with unusual sexual tastes
4) an eccentric idea

kinkajou.definition: arboreal fruit-eating mammal of tropical America with a long prehensile tail

kinky.definition: (used of sexual behavior) showing or appealing to bizarre or deviant tastes

kino.definition:
1) a gum obtained from various tropical plants; used as an astringent and in tanning
2) East Indian tree yielding a resin or extract often used medicinally and in e.g. tanning

kinsey.definition: United States zoologist best known for his interview studies of sexual behavior (1894-1956)

kinshasa.definition: the capital of the Democratic Republic of the Congo on the Congo river opposite Brazzaville

kinship.definition: (anthropology) relatedness or connection by blood or marriage or adoption

kyoto.definition: a city in central Japan on southern Honshu; a famous cultural center that was once the capital of Japan

kiowa.definition:
1) a member of a Tanoan people living in the southwestern United States
2) the Tanoan language spoken by the Kiowa

kip.definition:
1) sleep
2) the basic unit of money in Laos
3) a gymnastic exercise performed starting from a position with the legs over the upper body and moving to an erect position by arching the back and swinging the legs out and down while forcing the chest upright

kyphosis.definition: an abnormal backward curve to the vertebral column

kipling.definition: English author of novels and poetry who was born in India (1865-1936)

kirchhoff.definition: German physicist who with Bunsen pioneered spectrum analysis and formulated two laws governing electric networks (1824-1887)

kirghiz.definition:
1) a member of a people of Turkic speech and Mongolian race inhabiting vast regions of central Siberia
3) the Turkic language spoken by the Kirghiz

kiribati.definition: an island republic in the west central Pacific just to the south of the equator

kirkuk.definition: a city in northeastern Iraq; the center of a rich oilfield with pipelines to the Mediterranean

kirpan.definition: a ceremonial four-inch curved dagger that Sikh men and women are obliged to wear at all times

kirsch.definition: from fermented juice of black morello cherries

kirtle.definition:
1) a garment resembling a tunic that was worn by men in the Middle Ages
2) a long dress worn by women

kishar.definition: Babylonian consort of Anshar; in Sumerian the name signifies `the totality of the lower world'

kishke.definition: (Judaism) roasted fowl intestines with a seasoned filling of matzo meal and suet

kislev.definition: the third month of the civil year; the ninth month of the ecclesiastical year in the Jewish calendar (in November and December)

kiss.definition:
1) the act of caressing with the lips (or an instance thereof)
2) touch lightly or gently
3) any of several bite-sized candies

examples.en: the blossoms were kissed by the soft rain

kissimmee.definition: a river of central Florida that flows southward to Lake Okeechobee

kissinger.definition: United States diplomat who served under President Nixon and President Ford (born in 1923)

kisumu.definition: a port city in western Kenya on the northeastern shore of Lake Victoria; fishing and trading center

kit.definition:
1) a case for containing a set of articles
2) gear consisting of a set of articles or tools for a specified purpose
3) young of any of various fur-bearing animals

kitakyushu.definition: a Japanese city on northern Kyushu

kitchen.definition: a room equipped for preparing meals

kitchenware.definition: hardware utensils for use in a kitchen

kite.definition:
1) increase the amount (of a check) fraudulently
2) get credit or money by using a bad check
3) soar or fly like a kite

examples.en: The businessman kited millions of dollars
The pilot kited for a long time over the mountains

kitsch.definition: excessively garish or sentimental art; usually considered in bad taste

examples.en: our cat kittened again this year

kitty.definition: informal terms referring to a domestic cat

kittiwake.definition: small pearl-grey gull of northern regions; nests on cliffs and has a rudimentary hind toe

kyushu.definition: the southernmost of the four main islands of Japan; contains coal fields

kivu.definition: a lake in the mountains of central Africa between Congo and Rwanda

kiwi.definition:
3) fuzzy brown egg-shaped fruit with slightly tart green flesh
4) nocturnal flightless bird of New Zealand having a long neck and stout legs; only surviving representative of the order Apterygiformes

klaipeda.definition: a city in western Lithuania on the Baltic Sea; formerly an important trading town of the Hanseatic League

klamath.definition: a river flowing southwest from Oregon through northern California to the Pacific Ocean

klansman.definition: a member of the Ku Klux Klan

klaproth.definition: German chemist who pioneered analytical chemistry and discovered three new elements (1743-1817)

klavern.definition: a local unit of the Ku Klux Klan

klaxon.definition: a kind of loud horn formerly used on motor vehicles

klebsiella.definition: a genus of nonmotile rod-shaped Gram-negative enterobacteria; some cause respiratory and other infections

kleenex.definition: a piece of soft absorbent paper (usually two or more thin layers) used as a disposable handkerchief

klein.definition:
1) German mathematician who created the Klein bottle (1849-1925)
2) United States psychoanalyst (born in Austria) who was the first to specialize in the psychoanalysis of small children (1882-1960)
3) United States fashion designer noted for understated fashions (born in 1942)

kleist.definition: German dramatist whose works concern people torn between reason and emotion (1777-1811)

kleptomania.definition: an irresistible impulse to steal in the absence of any economic motive

kleptomaniac.definition: someone with an irrational urge to steal in the absence of an economic motive

klimt.definition: Austrian painter influenced by art nouveau (1862-1918)

klystron.definition: an electron tube used to generate or amplify electromagnetic radiation in the microwave region by velocity modulation

klondike.definition:
1) a region in northwestern Canada where gold was discovered in 1896 but exhausted by 1910
2) a form of solitaire that begins with seven piles of cards with the top cards facing up; descending sequences of cards of alternating colors are built on these piles; as aces become available they are placed above the seven piles; the object is to build sequences in suit from ace to king as the remaining cards are dealt out one at a time

kludge.definition: a badly assembled collection of parts hastily assembled to serve some particular purpose (often used to refer to computing systems or software that has been badly put together)

knacker.definition:
1) someone who buys old buildings or ships and breaks them up to recover the materials in them
2) someone who buys up old horses for slaughter

knapweed.definition: any of various plants of the genus Centaurea having purple thistlelike flowers

knawel.definition: widely distributed low-growing Eurasian herb having narrow leaves and inconspicuous green flowers

examples.en: work the clay until it is soft

knee.definition:
1) hinge joint in the human leg connecting the tibia and fibula with the femur and protected in front by the patella
3) the part of a trouser leg that provides the cloth covering for the knee

kneecap.definition: shoot in the kneecap, often done by terrorist groups as a warning

examples.en: we were standing knee-deep in the water

knee-high.definition: a sock or stocking that reaches up to just below the knees

kneel.definition: rest one's weight on one's knees

examples.en: In church you have to kneel during parts of the service

kneeler.definition:
1) a person in a kneeling position
2) a board (sometimes cushioned) for someone to kneel on

knife.definition:
1) use a knife on
2) a weapon with a handle and blade with a sharp point

examples.en: The victim was knifed to death
he lived on a knife-edge between genius and insanity

knifelike.definition:
1) cutting or able to cut as if with a knife
4) having a sharp or distinct edge

knight.definition:
1) raise (someone) to knighthood
2) a chessman shaped to resemble the head of a horse; can move two squares horizontally and one vertically (or vice versa)

knight-errant.definition: a wandering knight travelling in search of adventure

knighthood.definition: aristocrats holding the rank of knight

knightia.definition: small genus of trees or shrubs of New Zealand and New Caledonia

kniphofia.definition: a plant of the genus Kniphofia having long grasslike leaves and tall scapes of red or yellow drooping flowers

knish.definition: (Yiddish) a baked or fried turnover filled with potato or meat or cheese; often eaten as a snack

knit.definition:
1) make (textiles) by knitting
2) tie or link together
3) needlework created by interlacing yarn in a series of connected loops using straight eyeless needles or by machine

knitted.definition: made by intertwining threads in a series of connected loops rather than by weaving

knitter.definition: someone who makes garments (or fabrics) by intertwining yarn or thread

knob.definition:
1) a circular rounded projection or protuberance
2) a round handle
4) an ornament in the shape of a ball on the hilt of a sword or dagger

knobkerrie.definition: a short wooden club with a heavy knob on one end; used by aborigines in southern Africa

knock.definition:
1) deliver a sharp blow or push :"He knocked the glass clear across the room"
2) rap with the knuckles
3) a vigorous blow

examples.en: he took a bash right in his face

knockabout.definition:
1) a sloop with a simplified rig and no bowsprit
2) suitable for rough use

examples.en: I bought a knockdown chest at the do-it-yourself store

knock-down.definition: strong enough to knock down or overwhelm

knocker.definition:
1) (Yiddish) a big shot who knows it and acts that way; a boastful immoderate person
2) a person who knocks (as seeking to gain admittance)
5) a device (usually metal and ornamental) attached by a hinge to a door

examples.en: open the door and see who the knocker is

knock-knee.definition: an inward slant of the thigh

knock-kneed.definition: having the knees abnormally close together and the ankles wide apart

knockout.definition: a blow that renders the opponent unconscious

knossos.definition: an ancient town on Crete where Bronze Age culture flourished from about 2000 BC to 1400 BC

knot.definition:
1) make into knots; make knots out of
2) tie or fasten into a knot
3) a hard cross-grained round piece of wood in a board where a branch emerged

examples.en: the saw buckled when it hit a knot

knotgrass.definition: low-growing weedy grass with spikelets along the leaf stems

knothole.definition: a hole in a board where a knot came out

knout.definition: a whip with a lash of leather thongs twisted with wire; used for flogging prisoners

know.definition:
1) be cognizant or aware of a fact or a specific piece of information; possess knowledge or information about
2) know how to do or perform something
3) be aware of the truth of something; have a belief or faith in something; regard as true beyond any doubt

examples.en: I know that the President lied to the people
I want to know who is winning the game!
Does your husband know how to cook?
I know that I left the key on the table
Galileo knew that the earth moves around the sun

knower.definition: a person who knows or apprehends

know-how.definition: the (technical) knowledge and skill required to do something

knowing.definition:
1) evidencing the possession of inside information
4) highly educated; having extensive information or understanding

know-it-all.definition: someone who thinks he knows everything and refuses to accept advice or information from others

knowledgeability.definition: wisdom as evidenced by the possession of knowledge

examples.en: his dullness was due to lack of initiation
a knowing collector of rare books
surprisingly knowledgeable about what was going on
the limits of the known world

knox.definition: Scottish theologian who founded Presbyterianism in Scotland and wrote a history of the Reformation in Scotland (1514-1572)

knoxville.definition: a city in eastern Tennessee on the Tennessee River

knuckle.definition:
1) press or rub with the knuckles
2) shoot a marble while keeping one's knuckles on the ground

knuckleball.definition: a baseball pitch thrown with little speed or spin

koala.definition: sluggish tailless Australian arboreal marsupial with grey furry ears and coat; feeds on eucalyptus leaves and bark

koan.definition: a paradoxical anecdote or a riddle that has no solution; used in Zen Buddhism to show the inadequacy of logical reasoning

koasati.definition:
1) a member of the Muskhogean people formerly living in northern Alabama; a member of the Creek Confederacy
2) the Muskhogean language spoken by the Koasati

kob.definition: an orange-brown antelope of southeast Africa

kobe.definition: a port city in Japan on Osaka Bay in southern Honshu; was damaged by an earthquake in 1995

koch.definition: German bacteriologist who isolated the anthrax bacillus and the tubercle bacillus and the cholera bacillus (1843-1910)

kodiak.definition: an island off southern Alaska in the Gulf of Alaska; site of the first European settlement in the area which was founded by the Russians in 1784

koestler.definition: British writer (born in Hungary) who wrote a novel exposing the Stalinist purges during the 1930s (1905-1983)

kohl.definition: a cosmetic preparation used by women in Egypt and Arabia to darken the edges of their eyelids

kohlrabi.definition:
1) plant cultivated for its enlarged fleshy turnip-shaped edible stem
2) fleshy turnip-shaped edible stem of the kohlrabi plant

koine.definition: a Greek dialect that flourished under the Roman Empire

koinonia.definition: Christian fellowship or communion with God or with fellow Christians; said in particular of the early Christian community

kokka.definition: of or pertaining to the branch of Shinto recognized as the state religion of Japan

kola.definition: tree bearing large brown nuts containing e.g. caffeine; source of cola extract

kolami.definition: the Dravidian language spoken by the Kolam in central India

kolkhoz.definition: a collective farm owned by the communist state

komi.definition:
1) a member of a Finnish people living in the northwestern Urals in Russia
2) the Finnic language spoken by the Komi

komondor.definition: Hungarian breed of large powerful shaggy-coated white dog; used also as guard dog

kongo.definition: the Bantu language spoken by the Kongo living in the tropical forests of Zaire and Congo and Angola

konini.definition: erect deciduous shrub or tree to 10 feet with maroon flowers; New Zealand

kook.definition: someone regarded as eccentric or crazy and standing out from a group

kookaburra.definition: Australian kingfisher having a loud cackling cry

kopje.definition: a small hill rising up from the African veld

koran.definition: the sacred writings of Islam revealed by God to the prophet Muhammad during his life at Mecca and Medina

koranic.definition: of or related to the sacred texts of Islam

kordofan.definition: a mountainous province of central Sudan

kordofanian.definition: a group of languages spoken in the relatively small Kordofan area of the south Sudan

korea.definition: an Asian peninsula (off Manchuria) separating the Yellow Sea and the Sea of Japan; the Korean name is Dae-Han-Min-Gook or Han-Gook

korean.definition:
1) of or relating to or characteristic of Korea or its people or language
2) the Altaic language spoken by Koreans

koruna.definition:
1) the basic unit of money in Slovakia
2) the basic unit of money in Czech Republic

kos.definition: (in India) a unit of length having different values in different localities

kosciusko.definition: Polish patriot and soldier who fought with Americans in the American Revolution (1746-1817)

kosher.definition:
1) conforming to dietary laws
2) proper or legitimate

kosovo.definition: a Serbian province in southern Serbia and Montenegro populated predominantly by Albanians

kota.definition:
1) a member of the Dravidian people living in the Nilgiri Hills in southern India
2) a Dravidian language spoken by the Kota

koto.definition: Japanese stringed instrument that resembles a zither; has a rectangular wooden sounding board and usually 13 silk strings that are plucked with the fingers

kotoko.definition: a Chadic language spoken south of Lake Chad

koumiss.definition: an alcoholic beverage made from fermented mare's milk; made originally by nomads of central Asia

koussevitzky.definition: United States conductor (born in Russia) who was noted for performing the works of contemporary composers (1874-1951)

kowhai.definition: shrub or small tree of New Zealand and Chile having pendulous racemes of tubular golden-yellow flowers; yields a hard strong wood

kowtow.definition: a former Chinese custom of touching the ground with the forehead as a sign of respect or submission

kraal.definition:
1) a village of huts for native Africans in southern Africa; usually surrounded by a stockade
2) a pen for livestock in southern Africa

krafft-ebing.definition: German neurologist noted for his studies of sexual deviance (1840-1902)

kraft.definition: strong wrapping paper made from pulp processed with a sulfur solution

krait.definition: brightly colored venomous but nonaggressive snake of southeastern Asia and Malay peninsula

krakatau.definition: a small volcanic island in Indonesia between Java and Sumatra; its violent eruption in 1883 was the greatest in recorded history

krasner.definition: United States artist remembered for her spontaneous approach to painting; she was a founder of the New York school of abstract expressionism (1908-1984)

kraurosis.definition: atrophy and shriveling of the skin or mucous membrane

kraut.definition: offensive term for a person of German descent

krebs.definition: English biochemist (born in Germany) who discovered the Krebs cycle (1900-1981)

kremlin.definition:
1) citadel of Moscow, housing the offices of the Russian government
2) citadel of a Russian town

krigia.definition: any small branched yellow-flowered North American herb of the genus Krigia

krill.definition: shrimp-like planktonic crustaceans; major source of food for e.g. baleen whales

krypton.definition: a colorless element that is one of the six inert gasses; occurs in trace amounts in air

kris.definition: a Malayan dagger with a wavy blade

krishna.definition: 8th and most important avatar of Vishnu; incarnated as a handsome young man playing a flute

krishnaism.definition: worship of Krishna the 8th avatar of Vishnu

kroeber.definition: United States anthropologist noted for his studies of culture (1876-1960)

kroon.definition: the basic unit of money in Estonia

krubi.definition: malodorous tropical plant having a spathe that resembles the corolla of a morning glory and attains a diameter of several feet

krummhorn.definition: a Renaissance woodwind with a double reed and a curving tube (crooked horn)

krupp.definition:
1) German arms manufacturer and son of Friedrich Krupp; his firm provided ordnance for German armies from the 1840s through World War II (1812-1887)
2) German industrialist who manufactured steel in Essen (1787-1826)

kshatriya.definition: a member of the royal or warrior Hindu caste

kudu.definition: either of two spiral-horned antelopes of the African bush

kudzu.definition: fast-growing vine from eastern Asia having tuberous starchy roots and hairy trifoliate leaves and racemes of purple flowers followed by long hairy pods containing many seeds; grown for fodder and forage and root starch; widespread in the southern United States

kuhn.definition: Austrian chemist who did research on carotenoids and vitamins (1900-1967)

kui.definition:
1) a member of the Dravidian people living in southeastern India
2) the Dravidian language spoken by the Kui in southeastern India

kuki.definition: Kamarupan languages spoken in western Burma and Bangladesh and easternmost India

kulanapan.definition: a group of languages of the Hokan family

kummel.definition: liqueur flavored with caraway seed or cumin

kumquat.definition:
1) any of several trees or shrubs of the genus Fortunella bearing small orange-colored edible fruits with thick sweet-flavored skin and sour pulp
2) small oval citrus fruit with thin sweet rind and very acid pulp

kunlun.definition: a mountain range in western China that extends eastward from the Indian border for 1000 miles

kunzite.definition: a pinkish lilac crystal form of the mineral spodumene that is used as a gemstone

kuomintang.definition: the political party founded in 1911 by Sun Yat-sen; it governed China under Chiang Kai-shek from 1928 until 1949 when the Communists took power and subsequently was the official ruling party of Taiwan

kura.definition: a river in western Asia; rises in northeast Turkey and flows to the Caspian Sea

kurd.definition: a member of a largely pastoral Islamic people who live in Kurdistan; the largest ethnic group without their own state

kurdish.definition: of or relating to Kurdistan or the Kurds or their language and culture

kurdistan.definition:
1) an extensive geographical region in the Middle East to the south of the Caucasus
2) an oriental rug woven by Kurds that is noted for fine colors and durability

kurosawa.definition: Japanese filmmaker noted for blending Japanese folklore with western styles of acting (1910-1998)

kurrajong.definition: widely distributed tree of eastern Australia yielding a tough durable fiber and soft light attractively grained wood; foliage is an important emergency food for cattle

kurta.definition: a loose collarless shirt worn by many people on the Indian subcontinent (usually with a salwar or churidars or pyjama)

kuru.definition: a progressive disease of the central nervous system marked by increasing lack of coordination and advancing to paralysis and death within a year of the appearance of symptoms; thought to have been transmitted by cannibalistic consumption of diseased brain tissue since the disease virtually disappeared when cannibalism was abandoned

kusan.definition:
1) a member of the North American Indian people of Oregon
2) a Penutian language spoken by the Kusan

kutuzov.definition: Russian field marshal who commanded the Russian opposition to Napoleon (1745-1813)

kuvasz.definition: long-established Hungarian breed of tall light-footed but sturdy white dog; used also as a hunting dog

kuwait.definition:
1) a seaport on the Persian Gulf and capital of Kuwait
2) an Arab kingdom in Asia on the northwestern coast of the Persian Gulf; a major source of petroleum

kuwaiti.definition:
1) of or relating to the kingdom of Kuwait or its people
2) of or relating to the capital of Kuwait or its residents

examples.en: Kuwaiti streets are lined with luxury stores

kvass.definition: fermented beverage resembling beer but made from rye or barley

kvetch.definition:
1) (Yiddish) a constant complainer
2) (Yiddish) a nagging complaint

kwa.definition: a group of African language in the Niger-Congo group spoken from the Ivory Coast east to Nigeria

kwajalein.definition:
1) an atoll in the western Marshall Islands that was used as a Japanese air and naval base during World War II
2) an amphibious assault in the Pacific in World War II (January 1944); American forces landed and captured a Japanese air base

kwakiutl.definition:
1) a member of the Wakashan people living around Queen Charlotte Sound and on northern Vancouver Island
2) a Wakashan language spoken by the Kwakiutl

kwangju.definition: city in southwestern South Korea; an important military base during the Korean War

kwannon.definition: Japanese counterpart of Chinese Kuan Yin

kwanza.definition: the basic unit of money in Angola

kwashiorkor.definition: severe malnutrition in children resulting from a diet excessively high in carbohydrates and low in protein

kwela.definition: a kind of danceable music popular among black South Africans; includes a whistle among its instruments
